pull.title: Torcontrol opt check
pull.body:
Based on `SplitHostPort` from [#22087](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22087)

- Adds new utility for easy sanity check of network addresses
- Checks `-torcontrol` for a valid host:port string
- Adds a return param in `StartTorControl` so that we can stop init and present a message if `torcontrol` input is invalid

Solves #23589

Thanks a lot @vasild for your review; applied your proposed changes
@amadeuszpawlik can you rebase again, to fix the failing CI (see #26306).

events.message:
util: Adds `network`, network address validation

This utility implements the function `hasValidHostPort`, which conducts
a sanity check for a valid host:port combination in a string.
This can be used for rejection of invalid option strings. Rules for
a valid hostname are: not empty and no spaces, for port: not empty
and within `uint16` bounds.

Ensure valid network address in `-torcontrol`

- Returns error at init if `-torcontrol` is not a valid host:port combo.
- `StartTorControl` returns a `bool`, and has a return parameter `error`
where a suitable message is set at failure.

Fixes #23589

events.body: @amadeuszpawlik are you planning on addressing any of the feedback here?
@amadeuszpawlik @fanquake May I take over and wrap this one up?
@vstoyanov No need to ask for permission to contribute. I'd say go for it.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,22 @@
+// Copyright (c) 2022 The Bitcoin Core developers
+// Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+// file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+
+#include <util/network.h>
+#include <util/strencodings.h>
+#include <string>
+
+SocketAddrError hasValidHostPort(std::string_view socketAddr)
+{
+    uint16_t port{0};
+    std::string hostname;
+    bool validPort = SplitHostPort(socketAddr, port, hostname);
comments.body:
Build error here
```bash
util/network.cpp:13:10: error: cannot initialize a variable of type 'bool' with an rvalue of type 'void'
    bool validPort = SplitHostPort(socketAddr, port, hostname);
         ^           ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
1 error generated.
```

```suggestion
        res = (res == SocketAddrError::NO_PORT) ? SocketAddrError::NO_HOSTPORT
```

to appease the whitespace linter
```
+        res = (res == SocketAddrError::NO_PORT) ? SocketAddrError::NO_HOSTPORT 
^---- failure generated from lint-whitespace.py
```

+

+#include <string>
+
+SocketAddrError hasValidHostPort(std::string_view socketAddr)
+{
+    uint16_t port{0};
+    std::string hostname;
+    bool validPort = SplitHostPort(socketAddr, port, hostname);

comments.body:
This contains `in.substr(colon + 1)` two times. Maybe put it in a variable (`port_str`?) to make the code a bit easier to read.

There are a bunch of style issues. I would suggest to run `clang-format` or `contrib/devtools/clang-format-diff.py` on this.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -84,7 +84,16 @@ std::string EncodeBase32(Span<const unsigned char> input, bool pad = true);
  */
 std::string EncodeBase32(std::string_view str, bool pad = true);
 
-void SplitHostPort(std::string_view in, uint16_t& portOut, std::string& hostOut);
+/**
+ * Splits socket address string into host string and port value.
+ * Validates port value.
+ *
+ * @param[in] in        The socket address string to split.
+ * @param[out] portOut  Port-portion of the input, if found and parsable.
+ * @param[out] hostOut  Host-portion of the input, if found.
+ * @return              true if port-portion is absent or within its allowed range, otherwise false
+ */
+bool SplitHostPort(std::string_view in, uint16_t& portOut, std::string& hostOut);
comments.body: The parameters should use snake case, as per `doc/developer-notes.md`.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,19 @@
+// Copyright (c) 2022 The Bitcoin Core developers
+// Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+// file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+
+#ifndef BITCOIN_UTIL_NETWORK_H
+#define BITCOIN_UTIL_NETWORK_H
+
+#include <string_view>
+
+enum class SocketAddrError {
+    OK, //!< No error
+    NO_HOST,
+    NO_PORT,
+    NO_HOSTPORT,
+};
+
+SocketAddrError hasValidHostPort(std::string_view socketAddr);
comments.body:
In commit d8f230435bd828a80c56c66d4e0a7db11fd627ce `util: Adds network, socket address validation` this is added like:

```cpp
SocketAddrError hasValidHostPort(std::string_view socketAddr) {

#endif // BITCOIN_UTIL_NETWORK_H
```

which I guess will not compile. All commits should compile on their own.

comments.body: The rest of the codebase is using just "address" or "network address" (to distinguish from a bitcoin address), or host. Introducing a new name for the same thing could be confusing.

This is already fixed in #22087 (f8387c42343867779170a0f96ef64e6acff5c481)
Rebasing this away

comments.body:
style: `case` should be below `switch`

It is good to use `clang-format` or `contrib/devtools/clang-format-diff.py` to avoid such suggestions.
style: as per `doc/developer-notes.md` variables should use snake_case.

nit: for consistency with above
```suggestion
            error = Untranslated("No hostname:port specified in -torcontrol");
```
